page.title: 02THE SAPEYS AND HARPLEY
page.content: In addition to the village of{Clifton- {on-Teme}there are four other residential areas.{Upper Sapey}is a small hamlet on the Bromyard to Stourport road with it's own church, public house and post office. It did have a school but the building is now a private house. The parish of{Lower {Sapey}includes the hamlet of{Harpley, the latter being rather isolated and centred around the parish church of St. Bartholomew and Harpley Green. There is no school,shop or public house in Harpley but the people sometimes use the shop and public house (The Gate Hangs Well) on the main Bromyard road.{Sapey Common}is within the parish of Upper Sapey and is centred around a sharp bend on the Clifton to Tenbury road about one and a half miles from Clifton.It has no school,shop or other public amenities.
